title: COP30 Brazil: 195 Nations Pledge to Cut Emissions 60% by 2035
introText: In a historic agreement at COP30 in BelÃ©m, Brazil, world leaders committed to reducing greenhouse gas emissions by 60% by 2035. The deal includes binding targets, financial commitments for developing nations, and new mechanisms for accountability.

content.content: The BelÃ©m Climate Compact commits 195 nations to 60% emissions reductions by 2035, with developed nations pledging 70%. Unlike previous agreements, it includes binding enforcement mechanisms and trade-related consequences.

Wealthy nations committed $500 billion annually for developing country climate action. A separate $100 billion loss and damage fund will compensate nations suffering climate impacts they did not cause.

Hosting COP30 in the Amazon underscored the stakes. Brazil committed to ending deforestation by 2028. Indigenous leaders participated prominently, sharing traditional knowledge about forest protection.

summary: COP30 leaders commit to cutting emissions by 60% by 2035, with binding targets, financial support for developing nations, and new accountability mechanisms.
